thread.title: Ben Reid to return for Collingwood against Carlton and partner Darcy Moore up forward | The
thread.title_full: Ben Reid to return for Collingwood against Carlton and partner Darcy Moore up forward | The Advertiser

author: Lauren Wood
title: Ben Reid to return for Collingwood against Carlton and partner Darcy Moore up forward | The
text:
COLLINGWOOD will welcome back swingman Ben Reid after a 357-day layoff come Saturday’s must-win meeting with Carlton.
The 26-year-old has been plagued by soft tissue injuries and hasn’t played senior football since Round 21, 2014, but was last night named in the side that will face the Blues.
It is a welcome boost for the Magpies’ attack, which is missing power forward Travis Cloke who only trained lightly yesterday as he continues to battle a calf injury.
Young forward Darcy Moore, who is set to play his fifth senior game on Saturday, has only played alongside Reid in defence, and says he looks forward to lining up alongside the All-Australian in attack.
“It’s kind of a funny journey we’ve had — we were both in rehab together towards the end of January and February and spent six or eight weeks training together and made our return together to the VFL together in defence,” Moore said on Thursday.
“I’ve loved learning off him. I really rate him as a player. The switch has been flicked and we’re both playing at the other end of the ground and potentially on Saturday afternoon at the MCG.
“That’d be really exciting for me. On a personal level, we’ve been through a lot together this year and in the short time I’ve been at the club.”
Jarryd Blair and Ben Sinclair were also recalled by the Magpies while key defender Jonathon Marsh was named to make his debut.
Ben Reid and Darcy Moore oppose each other at training on Thursday. Picture: Wayne Ludbey Source: News Corp Australia
Sam Dwyer, Jarrod Witts and Paul Seedsman were omitted from the side that lost to Melbourne, while youngster Jordan De Goey was rested.
The Magpies are looking to arrest a six-game losing streak on Saturday, with Moore saying Thursday’s training session was “the best (they) have had all year”.
He says they have left last Saturday’s loss to Melbourne behind and are looking to finally turn their fortunes tomorrow, hopefully allowing him to draw on his singing voice for the first time since being drafted as a father-son pick at the end of last season.
“The sentimental part of me obviously wants to sing the song for the first time and I’ve worn the stripes now four times and haven’t been able to get the four points, so it’s pretty disappointing,” he said.
“It won’t be at the forefront of my mind until after the game and I’ll get to share that experience, hopefully, with my teammates. Until then, we’ll just be focusing on the process we need to get that result.
“You can dwell on (the losing streak) … but the reality is we’ve got another opportunity on Saturday against our old rivals the Blues.”
Originally published as Moore, Reid to form two-pronged attack
